content:
Sure, here's a 7-day meal plan that's healthy, low in fat, and estimated to cost around $100 or less:

Day 1:

* Breakfast: Oatmeal with banana and cinnamon.
* Lunch: Turkey and cheese wrap with mixed greens and cherry tomatoes.
* Dinner: Spaghetti squash with turkey meatballs and tomato sauce.

Day 2:

* Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with spinach and whole grain toast.
* Lunch: Tuna salad with mixed greens and cucumber.
* Dinner: Baked chicken breast with roasted vegetables (carrots, broccoli, and zucchini).

Day 3:

* Breakfast: Greek yogurt with fresh berries and a sprinkle of granola.
* Lunch: Black bean and corn salad with mixed greens and cherry tomatoes.
* Dinner: Lentil soup with a side of whole grain crackers.

Day 4:

* Breakfast: Smoothie made with spinach, banana, almond milk, and peanut butter.
* Lunch: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and a light vinaigrette dressing.
* Dinner: Baked sweet potato topped with black beans, salsa, and avocado.

Day 5:

* Breakfast: Cottage cheese with fresh fruit and a sprinkle of chopped nuts.
* Lunch: Whole wheat pita stuffed with hummus, cucumber, tomato, and feta cheese.
* Dinner: Grilled fish with roasted asparagus and a side of brown rice.

Day 6:

* Breakfast: Smoothie made with spinach, banana, almond milk, and peanut butter.
* Lunch: Chicken and veggie stir-fry with brown rice.
* Dinner: Baked salmon with roasted sweet potatoes and green beans.

Day 7:

* Breakfast: Scrambled eggs with spinach and whole grain toast.
* Lunch: Lentil and vegetable soup with a side of whole grain crackers.
* Dinner: Baked chicken breast with roasted vegetables (carrots, broccoli, and zucchini).

Remember to stay hydrated throughout the day by drinking plenty of water and engaging in regular physical activity to complement your healthy eating habits. I hope you find this meal plan helpful and delicious!
